overview:
Kevin Kane is a dedicated entrepreneur who has served in a sales/marketing capacity for successful venture backed technology companies: Beyond Software - acquired by NEON, Tivoli Systems - acquired by IBM, Dazel - acquired by HP, VIEO - acquired by Cesura, Meridian Systems - acquired by Trimble and currently serves as EVP for a retail competitive intelligence service provider - RivalWatch.

As VP and GM for Unify Corporation, Kevin participated in moving the OTC public company to NASDAQ (UNFY) due in large part to his efforts in establishing a new strategic alliance with Microsoft. Following the successful re-listing on NASDAQ, Kevin conducted due diligence that resulted in four acquisitions in four years of leading technology companies in migration, archiving and e-Discovery verticals. Kevin launched a new SaaS solution in Tokyo, Sydney, Melbourne, Milan, Frankfurt, London and Paris resulting in an endorsement from Microsoft throughout its global partner/customer ecosystem

Kevin served on advisory boards for early ventures including Ziios during its acquisition by Dominion Enterprises in 2010 (pre-revenue) and Orchestria prior to its acquisition by Computer Associates in 2009.

Kevin lived in The Netherlands while serving in the US Air Force during Desert Shield/Storm and currently resides in the Sacramento, CA area.

“The purpose of bureaucracy is to compensate for incompetence and lack of discipline.” Jim Collins, author Good to Great.
